business.headline: RIL Q2 profit slips 5% to Rs 16,563 crore, still beats market expectationsRIL Q2 results: Reliance Industries beat street expectations in Q2 despite a 5% drop in profit, driven by strong digital and upstream growth.

HCLTech Q2 results: Net profit jumps 11% to Rs 4,235 crore, dividend declaredHCLTech declared another interim dividend of Rs 12 per share, taking the total interim dividend for the fiscal year so far to Rs 42 per share.

Retail inflation jumps to 9-month high of 5.49% in SeptemberFood prices saw an even more significant spike, with the Consumer Food Price Index (CFPI) recording a year-on-year inflation rate of 9.24%. Rural areas faced food inflation of 9.08%, while urban areas experienced an increase of 9.56%.

Hyundai Motor IPO opens tomorrow: Check latest GMP, brokerage reviews and moreHyundai Motor India IPO: Priced between Rs 1,865 and Rs 1,960 per share, the IPO is expected to raise Rs 27,856 crore through an offer for sale of 14.2 crore shares, representing a 17.5% stake.

Sensex ends 600 points higher, Nifty gains; Wipro, HDFC Bank stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 591.69 points to 81,973.05 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 163.70 points to settle at 25, 127.95.

Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson, James A. Robinson awarded Nobel Economics Prize 2024Nobel Economics Prize 2024: This year's laureates provide valuable insights into how institutions are formed and their crucial role in fostering sustainable development and prosperity.

DA hike before Diwali? Big update for central government employeesDearness Allowance (DA) is revised twice a year, providing employees with financial support that helps maintain their purchasing power as living costs rise.

Gold, silver price today, October 14, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today October 14, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

HDFC Bank shares rise 2% ahead of Q2 results. What should investors do? HDFC Bank share price: Investors are showing increased interest in HDFC Bank shares, anticipating a positive performance in the upcoming quarterly results.
Explained: Why DMart shares plunged 9% in early trade todayThe sharp decline in shares came after DMart's second-quarter earnings failed to meet the market's expectations.
Sensex jumps 500 points, Nifty above 25,000; Wipro, HDFC Bank gain The S&P BSE Sensex was up 409.75 points to 81,791.11 at 10:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 126.45 points to trade at 25,090.70.

Succession Wars: The Hinduja family's bitter battle for controlAt the heart of the Hinduja family's success was their ethos of shared ownership, but this same principle ultimately sparked their multi-billion dollar feud, endangering an empire built on unity.

Boeing to cut 17,000 jobs as losses deepen amid factory strikeThe planemaker will also delay the delivery of its first 777X jet by a year. Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg said that the comapny must shrink its workforce "to align with financial reality".

Fortunes soar: India's richest cross $1 trillion mark amid market rallyForbes' analysis shows that India's 100 richest individuals now have a total net worth of $1.1 trillion, more than doubling their wealth since 2019.

From Trent to Titan: Noel Tata's journey to the top of Tata TrustNoel Tata, born to Naval Tata and Simone Tata, has been a key figure in the Tata Group for many years. He holds several senior positions within the conglomerate.

Nariman Point's revival: Office rents expected to nearly double by 2030The report, titled 'South Mumbai – A Renaissance', attributes this expected surge to ongoing infrastructure improvements and rising demand for premium office space in the area.

Noel Tata on being named Tata Trusts Chairman: Will carry on legacy of Ratan TataNoel Tata was named Tata Trusts Chairman after a board meeting held in Mumbai on October 11, where the decision was unanimously agreed upon by the trustees.
Financial crisis looms in Delhi as extra spending tips city into revenue deficitSeveral departments have underscored additional resource needs, which strain the budget further.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as foreign investment fizzles; Tata Group shares gainThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 230.05 points to close at 81,381.36, while the Nifty50 declined by 34.20 points to end at 24,964.25.
Tata group stocks surge 3% as Noel Tata takes charge at Tata TrustsNoel Tata's appointment came after the death of Ratan Tata, former chairman of Tata Sons, on October 9 at the age of 86.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Canada throws in 'Bishnoi gang' to push old charge against IndiaCanada alleged that Indian agents present on its soil are working with the Lawrence Bishnoi gang to target pro-Khalistan elements. Incidentally, the allegations come at a time when Lawrence Bishnoi is in the news in India for his alleged involvement in the murder of NCP leader Baba Siddique.

India has denied, obfuscated, attacked me personally: Trudeau on Nijjar killingCanadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau claimed authorities have "clear and compelling evidence" that agents of the Indian government are involved in activities threatening public safety, including clandestine operations and coercion targeting South Asian Canadians.

Watch: Canada cops' self-goal on charges of India targeting Sikh CanadiansThe Royal Canadian Mounted Police seemingly shot itself in the foot with an inadvertent admission while detailing its investigation into Nijjar's murder and related cases and their links to "agents of the Indian government".

Maharashtra, Jharkhand election dates to be announced todayThe Election Commission will announce the schedule for Assembly elections in Maharashtra and Jharkhand today. Besides the polls for the two assemblies, the poll panel can also announce bypolls for three Lok Sabha seats and 12 Assembly seats of UP and Gujarat.

Why Ukrainian military is raiding weddings, nightclubsAmid the war with Russia, Ukrainian defence personnel are raiding weddings, concerts, nightclubs and bars to nab men who are dodging military service. This comes after Ukraine brought down the conscription age from 27 to 25, and passed a law making it mandatory for all those eligible for service to register online.

India expels 6 Canadian diplomats, recalls its envoy as row escalatesThe government's move came hours after Canada's charge against the Indian High Commissioner and other diplomats as 'persons of interest' in the investigation into Khalistani terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar's murder.

Bahraich violence: Situation grim, Yogi Adityanath to meet victim's family todayUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath will meet the family of a 22-year-old man who was shot dead during a Goddess Durga idol immersion procession in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich district. The local BJP MLA will also be present during the meeting.

IND vs NZ: Bengaluru Test 'extra significant' for Rachin Ravindra due to rootsRachin Ravindra has said that the first Test between India and New Zealand in Bengaluru would be extra special for him because of his roots being firmly established in the city. Rachin's parents hail from the city while his grandparents still live here.
Ghost poop is more common than you think, but what is it?'Ghost poop' is not spooky as its name would suggest, but it actually spells good news for your digestive system.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme: Shaping the Future of Tech LeadershipAdvance your career with IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme. Designed for aspiring tech leaders, this programme offers cutting-edge insights, practical experience, and strategic acumen to navigate the digital era. Gain the skills to drive innovation, lead digital transformations, and position yourself as a visionary in technology leadership.

Netanyahu denies attacking peacekeepers in Lebanon: Move out of harm's wayBenjamin Netanyahu claimed that the Israeli Defence Forces did their best to avoid harming UNIFIL peacekeepers while striking Hezbollah targets in Lebanon.

SCO summit: Indian journalist in Pakistan after 9 years of diplomatic freezeExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and 7 heads of state will attend the two-day Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit starting today in Islamabad.

Actor Bala out on bail, asked to stop commenting on wife, daughterMalayalam actor Bala has been granted conditional bail, hours after his arrest. The Kerala police took him into custody after a complaint from ex-wife, Amrutha Suresh.

Chennai on alert for heavy rain, schools shut, work from home advisedTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has asked the information technology (IT) companies to allow their employees to work from home till October 18, amid a heavy rain alert.

Nazi Swastika flags seen at boat parade organised by Trump supporters, spark rowThe organiser of the parade said that the boat carrying Swastika flags was not a part of the boat parade that was carried out in support of Donald Trump.
Europa Clipper begins epic journey to find what's hiding on Jupiter's moonAfter traveling nearly 2.9 billion kilometers, the spacecraft will begin a series of 49 close flybys of Europa in 2030.

Salman Khan gets additional layers of security after Baba Siddique's murderSalman Khan has been provided with Y-plus security and a police escort vehicle now travels alongside his vehicle, sources told India Today TV. The development comes in light of the murder of former Maharashtra minister Baba Siddique, who was a close friend of Salman Khan.

Trump pauses Arizona rally, praises supporter: I would say that's beautifulDuring his rally in Arizona, a battleground state, Donald Trump paused his speech to compliment a female supporter, sparking a light-hearted moment where he joked about political correctness.

Prohibitory orders in parts of Kolkata for puja carnival amid doctors' stirThe Kolkata Police has banned gatherings of five or more people on Red Road and its adjoining areas in Kolkata for the Durga Puja Carnival today amid protest calls from the BJP and doctors agitating over the RG Kar hospital incident.

Kanguva producer makes tall claims, says Suriya-starrer will earn Rs 2,000 croreKanguva producer KE Gnanavel Raja claimed that Suriya's upcoming film will earn Rs 2,000 crore at the worldwide box office. The film, directed by Siva, will release in theatres on November 14.

Rapper Sean 'Diddy' Combs hit with six more sexual abuse lawsuitsSean 'Diddy' Combs faces six new sexual abuse lawsuits, including one involving a minor, amid ongoing criminal charges for sex trafficking. His lawyers deny all allegations, asserting his innocence.

Sunny Leone celebrates daughter's birthday with paps, fans praise her 'golden heart'Actor Sunny Leone's daughter, Nisha, celebrated her ninth birthday with a special gesture. On October 14, Sunny and her family were seen in Mumbai, sharing cake with the paparazzi to celebrate Nisha's special day.

Amitabh Bachchan says father Harivanshrai was depressed after first wife's deathAmitabh Bachchan shared how his father Harivanshrai Bachchan grieved after his first wife Shyama's death until he met Teji, his future wife, at a friend's home, leading to their marriage in 1941.

Taylor Swift-Travis Kelce enjoy cosy baseball date in New YorkTaylor Swift and Travis Kelce were spotted cosying up during a recent baseball game in New York City. A video capturing the same has gone viral online.

Vivo X200 series launched in China: Check out price,specs and more Vivo has unveiled its new flagship X200 series in China, featuring the latest MediaTek Dimensity 9400 chipset and offering significant enhancements in performance, battery life, and camera capabilities.
Adobe introduces Firefly AI video generator with three new toolsAdobe's AI video models include three new tools; Text-to-Video, Image-to-Video, and Generative Extend.

Reliance Jio lobbies India on satellite spectrum in new face-off with Elon MuskMukesh Ambani's Reliance Jio has argued that the telecom regulator incorrectly concluded that home satellite broadband spectrum should be allocated and not auctioned, a letter seen by Reuters shows, intensifying a face-off with Elon Musk's Starlink.

OpenAI reveals how cybercriminals are asking ChatGPT to write malwareOpenAI's latest report reveals how cybercriminals are exploiting ChatGPT to write malware and conduct cyber-attacks, raising concerns over AI misuse.

India vs New Zealand 1st Test Live Streaming: When and where to watch live India host New Zealand for a three-match Test series, starting October 16 at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. Find out all the live-streaming details of the much-awaited contest.

Kohli will be key in the series for India as they prep for the Australia tour.

10-man France edge past Belgium, Germany beat NetherlandsRandal Kolo Muani scored a brace to help 10-man France edge past Belgium while Germany defeated Netherlands 1-0 in the UEFA Nations League on 14 October, Monday.

Impact Player rule scrapped for Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2024 The BCCI has decided to scrap the contentious Impact Player rule for the upcoming Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy. The Impact Player concept was introduced in SMAT a couple of years ago.

Pakistan vs New Zealand, 2nd Test: Desperate Pakistan aim for turnaroundPakistan will aim to reverse their fortunes in the second Test against England after a crushing innings defeat in the opener. In a surprising decision, the PCB dropped senior players, banking on fresh faces and bold tactics.

Aakash Chopra cheekily shuts down troll over Burmah no-ball postFormer India cricketer Aakash Chopra had a witty response to an online troll on X, who attempted to mock him with a picture of Jasprit Bumrah's infamous no-ball from the 2017 Champions Trophy. Chopra clapped back by sharing the viral image of Mohammad Amir's controversial no-ball, leaving fans amused.

Babar is not the problem: Nasser Hussain questions Pakistan's mismanagementPakistan vs England: Former England captain Nasser Hussain has questioned the Pakistan Cricket Board's (PCB) mismanagement of the national men's team ahead of the second Test.

Explained: Why Pakistan are playing on same Multan pitch for successive Tests Pakistan vs England, 2nd Test: In a desperate bid for a quick turnaround, Pakistan have resorted to a never-seen-before tactic. Multan will employ a used pitch for the second Test, which effectively means the opening day of the match will be played on a Day 6 pitch at the iconic venue. Pakistan have picked a spin-heavy XI for the encounter, starting October 15.

India not thinking about Australia: Gambhir ahead of New Zealand TestIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir stressed that the team's sole focus remains on the upcoming Test series against New Zealand, keeping future matches, including the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, off their radar for now.

Shahid Afridi reacts to Pakistan resting Babar, Shaheen and Naseem in England TestsFormer captain Shahid Afridi said he supports the selectors' decision to rest Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi and Naseem Shah for the last two Tests against England. The decision to leave out the three star cricketers, including their former captain, has divided opinions in Pakistan cricket fraternity.

Rachin explains how Jadeja-Ashwin make India unbeatable at home in TestsNew Zealand all-rounder Rachin Ravindra stated on Monday that neutralising the double danger offered by senior spinners Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja will be critical to New Zealand's success in the three-match series against India.

Women's Hockey India League 2024-25 auction: All you need to knowThe Hockey India League (HIL) 2024-25 returns with a historic women's league and auction, marking a significant step towards gender parity in Indian hockey, featuring top domestic and international stars vying for a spot in the inaugural edition.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
